In this session we will be discussing from the 38th and the 39th verses of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
The 38th verse
Pratishrutam Chabhavata Panchalyei Shunvatomama
Aharishye Shrastasya
Yaste Maanini Putraha
The meaning of this verse is
Krishna is telling Arjuna
Furthermore I have personally heard you promise Draupadi
that you would bring forth the head of the killer of her sons.
This was what Arjuna had told Draupadi
when Draupadi informed Arjuna that Ashwatthama has killed her five sleeping sons.
So what was it that Arjuna had promised?
In the 16th verse of the same chapter
Arjuna had said
O gentle lady, when I present you with the head of that brahmana, after beheading him
with arrows from my Gandiva bow, I shall then wipe the tears from your eyes and pacify you.
Then after burning your sons bodies, you can take your baths standing on his head.
Arjuna was very angry.
angry at the act of Ashwathama killing the beheading just cutting off their
head when they were sleeping the five sleeping sons of Draupadi totally
against all principles of Dharma Yudha and so if Arjuna had promised to

this Ashwatthama acted like a butcher. Therefore Ashwatthama was taken as such
and there is no question of sin in killing such a Brahmana son who proved
to be a villain. So there is no sin involved in killing an aggressor.
Atatai. Now Krishna will use that word Atatai in the next verse 39th verse
Krishna says
The meaning of this 39th verse. This man is an assassin and murderer of your own
family members. Assassin and murderer. Not only that but he has
also dissatisfied his master. He is but the burnt remnants of his family. Kill
him immediately. So this is Krishna's instruction to Arjuna. That Krishna is
telling this Ashwatthama he is a murderer of your own family members. He
also dissatisfied his master. Who was Ashwathama's master? It was Duryodhana and when Ashwathama
revealed to Duryodhana that I have killed and Duryodhana couldn't understand. This Ashwathama
has not fought against them and killed them in a fair battle. He has killed them while they were
sleeping. So Duryodhana did not approve of this heinous act at all. Duryodhana was totally
dissatisfied with this. He said you have not done the right thing.
So therefore Ashwathama is described as the burnt remnants of his family.
He has completely degraded himself. Shamelessly has degraded himself. Therefore Krishna tells
Arjuna kill him immediately. He deserves this kind of punishment. So in the purport Srila Prabhupada
explains the son of Dronacharya is condemned here as the burnt remnants of his family.
How is Ashwathama the burnt remnants of his family? That's explained by Prabhupada.
The good name of Dronacharya was very much respected.
Although Dronacharya joined the enemy camp, the Pandavas held him always in respect
and Arjuna saluted him before beginning the fight. There was nothing wrong in that way.
Fighting on the opposite sides.
Arjuna is obviously on the pandavas side but Dronacharya, he is the teacher of Arjuna.

disciple is telling the teacher, please give me your blessing to fight.
and Dronacharya, he is telling yes you have my blessings to fight in this
Dharma Yudha. So continuing the purport of Srila Prabhupada But the son of Dronacharya
degraded himself by committing acts which were never done by the dvijas or the
twice-born higher castes. Who are the twice-born higher castes? The dvijas or
twice-born higher castes belong to the first three varanas.

Brahmana, Kshatriya and Vaishya. They are the first birth from their parents and there is a second birth. How is the second birth possible? By accepting the spiritual master as the father and Vedas as the mother.

Veda Mata, Guru Pita. During the second birth which is meant for beginning the learning of the Vedas. They go to Gurukul. In the Vedic culture they are sent to Gurukul to be trained up. Brahmanas, Kshatriyas and Vaishyas. They are trained up by a qualified teacher, qualified Brahmana.
This is called cultural purification. Samskara. It is called Samskara. It is cultural purification. Human life is meant for purification. So even by performing Samskaras this purification happens.
The scriptures declare Janmana Jayate Shudra Samskarat Vijam Uchyate.

So by birth from parents everyone is born a Shudra. But by spiritual initiation one becomes a Vidya. That initiation happens when one goes to a Guru and submits to the Guru. I am your disciple. Please accept me as your disciple and train me, teach me. Vedic knowledge.
So continuing the purport.

Then murder by killing the five sleeping sons of Draupadi. This is murder. This is not like Kshatriya fights in a Dharma Yuga and kills the enemy. It is not like that. In that there is no sin. It is not to be considered as murder. Fighting in a Dharma Yuga.
But here the sleeping sons of Draupadi were killed by Ashwathama.
And by this act of killing the sleeping sons of Draupadi, this Ashwathama dissatisfied his master Duryodhana.
Duryodhana never approved of the heinous act of killing the five sleeping sons of the Pandavas.
Now Duryodhana also was fighting the battle of Kurukshetra following the principles of Dharma Yuga.
This is explained earlier by
Krishna.
Suptam means sleeping. One who is sleeping is not to be killed.
So therefore Ashwathama became an assaulter of Arjuna's family members and thus he was liable to be punished by Arjuna.
And therefore Krishna tells Arjuna.
Now you must actually kill this aggressor Ashwathama. You should kill him.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
